Package dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.xpath

XPath Registration This package contains classes that allows the registration of own XPath functions.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractXPathFunctions
    This is a Helper class.
    CurrentContext
    This class wraps an JXPath context and provides a method to get a corresponding DCtxt.

Package dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.xpath Description

XPath Registration

This package contains classes that allows the registration of own XPath functions.

The classes in this package must not be instantiated directly. The class AbstractXPathFunctions is an abstract class, which every registered XPath class must extend. CurrentContext is an internal class that is passed to each XPath function in the registered XPath class and has a function to obtain the DCtxt of the current xpath-context.

Usage

To register an own XPath class, the extension point: 

dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.xpathregistration
has to be defined.

All extensions registered at this extension-point must define a namespace and a class. The class must have a public default-constructor. All public static methods of this class will be available as new XPath-functions within the given namespace. For example, if your namespace is "test" and there is a public static method "myfunction", you can access the new XPath-function with test:myfunction()

Namespaces not available by default are:

  • node
  • text
  • num
  • bit
  • var
  • as

For more information on the extension point please refer to the extension point description in your Eclipse IDE.

Implementing An XPath Method

Each method that is implemented in an xpath function class needs to have the following method signature. 

public static Object myXPathMethod( CurrentContext context, ( Object o )* )
As parameters there can be 0 - * Objects, but the CurrentContext is mandatory at the first position. To obtain a DCtxt call 
getDCtxt()
on the CurrentContext. To convert the Object parameters some Utility methods from AbstractXPathFunctions should be used.
  • toInt( Object o )
  • toFloat( Object o )
  • toBoolean( Object o )
  • toString( Object o )
  • toDCtxt( Object o )
  • toList( Object o )
  • toList( Object o, boolean resolveValues )
  • stringifyFirstElement( Object o )
  • stringifyList( Object o )
  • stringifyList( Object o, String delim )

Returning A Value

To obtain a correct return value, just use 

getReturnValue( CurrentContext context, Object o )
and return the value returned by this method.
